technique.short-name: Providing text and non-text alternatives for object

applicability.p: Documents that load media with the object element, when the media format is not an accessibility-supported content technology.

ua-issue.name: general
ua-issue.p: This technique is not supported well by assistive technologies and cross-browser support is irregular.

description.p: If object is used, provide a text alternative in the content of the element:
This example shows a text alternative for a Java applet using the object element.

eg-group.code: <object classid="java:Press.class" width="500" height="500"> As temperature increases, the molecules in the balloon... </object>

description.p: This example takes advantage of the fact the object elements may be nested to provide for alternative representations of information.

eg-group.code: <object classid="java:Press.class" width="500" height="500"> <object data="Pressure.mpeg" type="video/mpeg"> <object data="Pressure.gif" type="image/gif"> As temperature increases, the molecules in the balloon... </object> </object> </object>
